alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Craven; Jones (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 4:24PM EDT until August 27 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of eastern North Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Craven, Jones and Pamlico. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 424 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Bern, James City, Trent Woods, River Bend, Olympia, Grantsboro, Rhems, Maribel, Merritt, Fairfield Harbour, Coastal Carolina Regional Airport, Bayboro, Alliance, Bridgeton, Pollocksville and Stonewall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
